place.name: RAGNALL
place.gazetteerText: RAGNALL, a village and a parish in East Retford district, Notts. The village stands ¾ of a mile W of the river Trent, and 4 E N E of Tuxford r. station; and has a post-office under Newark. The parish contains also the hamlet of Whimpton-Moor, and comprises 1,000 acres. Real property, £2, 315. Pop., 204. Houses, 44. The manor belongs to J. Angerstein, Esq. R. Hall is the seat of D. W. Cartwright, Esq. The living is a p.curacy, annexed to the vicarage of Dunham, in the diocese of Lincoln. The church was restored in 1865. (In 1870-72, John Marius Wilson's Imperial Gazetteer of England and Wales)
